summary:
I'm an internationalist, travel and UX writer, and social media enthusiast packed with experience in international markets from South America to Europe and Asia-Pacific. Well-versed in online business and community management, content development and marketing campaign engagement. Now rocking the copy community as UX Core Writer at Boolong.com, revamping internal and customer-facing content for new products, App and Web platforms, tools and user flows.

Previous experiences offered me the opportunity to work with finance, office and team management, mentoring juniors and new-hires, community outreach, translations and international education and tourism. I've also created a lusophone website (currently on hiatus), and got articles featured online at Trivago (Room5/Magazine), Engoo.com, and a special contribution to a printed 'South America on a Budget' travel guide.

I am passionate about multicultural workplaces, keeping equal opportunities, and promoting open communication to develop a creative work environment. Count on me to bring ideas to the table and make things really work.

school.name: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de São Paulo

awards.title: 1st prize Hackathon
awards.description: Developed the project and mock-ups for 'Day stays', a way to benefit our partners and a range of customers willing to use only the facilities of an accommodation for a limited time. During the day, many properties stay empty as guests arrive mostly for the night. As a way of generating extra income, this project aimed to offer the use of their facilities during the day, such as pool, spa, conference rooms, in an easy to book way with instant confirmation. The project won the 1st prize in the Hackathon 2021 in the category 'Value Leadership Partners' and was the top-voted project overall in 2021.

awards.title: PUC-SP University Scholarship
awards.description: Won a bachelor's degree scholarship at PUC-SP University.
awards.issuer: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de São Paulo - PUC-SP

awards.title: Computing Scholarship
awards.description:
Won a scholarship to study Computing.
Admission test: 90%.

certifications.name: Brazilian Investments Certificate: Certificação dos Profissionais do Setor Financeiro da Associação Nacional das Instituições do Mercado Financeiro

projects.title: Gui Por Aí - website
projects.description:
This online platform targets the lusophone audience, providing assistance and information for international students, expatriates and travellers during their time abroad. This idea came from my previous experiences working with International Education and from my experience as a traveller in 60+ countries.

As a non-profit project, all information posted is free and there are tools available for users to communicate, search and ask questions, as well as the possibility to share their own experiences and photos.

Following the website, social network pages were created to support and advertise the project. The project is currently in a hiatus due to professional commitments.

projects.title: Inclusive Language for Social Media
projects.description:
The project was an independent follow-up to the Inclusive Language project from Booking.com Content team and aimed to apply the same resources and findings to the company's Social Media channels. 

The final result was a compact guide on how to address the inbound engagements on the different platforms we are currently present. It provides a comprehensive understanding of how to address single engagements and campaign interactions online, customising responses and keeping the company's Tone of Voice and Brand standards.

By promoting it internally, an appendix with best practices and cultural approaches for local markets was also added to keep our message relevant in other languages as well. This part counted with great collaboration and valuable insights from our specialists in Spanish, Portuguese, French and Italian.

projects.title: Sustainable Workplace - Reducing the usage of plastic
projects.description:
Created and managed this internal project to reduce the daily use of plastic disposable cups and promote the use of personalised reusable mugs.

Each employee got the chance to choose their ceramic mug's nickname and, already in the first month, the use of plastic cups was drastically reduced by 80%. I have also supervised the donation of the remaining stock of unused plastic cups to a local NGO.

profile_positions.description:
Professional evolution within the company:
 • Coordinator and London Office Manager - 2012-2013
 • Dept Supervisor and Team Lead - 2011-2012
 • Exchange Students Preboarding Support - 2011

Main responsibilities:
Provide exquisite personalized customer service, manage a small team of administrative and commercial assistants, prepare spreadsheets, financial statements and control petty cash flow, create presentations and reports, online conferences via Blackboard, banking, manage schedules, accommodations and booking systems, handling paperwork with high level of attention to details and quality standards including personal and business documents, data-entry, forms, requests and enquiries, main and secondary email inboxes and phone calls.

The main goals were to assist exchange students and expatriates before and during their education programs, to negotiate with partners and clients, organize events, target sales, tour retail and tour guiding. From front-desk to support, we aimed to offer our services throughout the various processes of an international exchange program such as enrolment in Universities and Language Schools, visa applications and related documents, VTMs, insurance and general support.

Always keeping equal opportunities and promoting a creative target/customer-driven but micromanagement-free working environment, me and my team received great feedbacks from customers in our monthly online surveys, reaching up to 152% of the company's satisfaction goals.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator and Office Manager

Also member of ECOA, group of employees that aimed to promote environmental and social responsibility actions as well as manage the quality of worklife.
profile_positions.title: Administrative and Business Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description:
As Creative Video Talent, my role was to show how international Amsterdam is by using my experience in developing short films. Involved in all stages, from project planing, invitations, interviews and filming, to the edition and delivery of the final video to IamExpat.nl.
 
IamExpat.nl's objective is to facilitate the integration of expatriates in the Netherlands. The video was exhibited at the IamExpat Fair in Amsterdam on April 7th, 2018.

Social Media Reporter at the Utrecht Heritage Open Day 2017.
Development of visual content for Facebook and Instagram pages in real time, aiming to inform and attract visitors, promote Utrecht's touristic attractions, and almost 70 heritage sites.

Site assistant. Support tourists and attendees at Sydney Open, an initiative to let people see the 'behind the scenes' of Sydney’s heritage buildings and diverse architecture. The 2016 edition counted with more than 400 buildings to explore, so visitors could learn a bit more about the city’s architectural gems.

Support the development of the Wheelmap app for wheelchair users by actively mapping streets, sidewalks and public places, from restaurants, hotels and hospitals, to shops, bus stops, and multiple service providers. All entries are classified according to their accessibility level, availability of adapted public toilets and ramps.
